main event: On June 7, 1952, in El Mojan, Venezuela, Lieutenant Commander Richard Byrd and five others sighted a metallic, oblong-shaped object hovering over the trees. The object was estimated to be about 40-50 feet long and 15-20 feet wide, remaining visible for about 5 minutes before accelerating and disappearing from view.
interesting points: The sighting was made by Lieutenant Commander Richard Byrd and five others, adding credibility to the report.
The UFO was described as metallic and oblong-shaped, with specific dimensions of 40-50 feet long and 15-20 feet wide.
The object hovered over the trees before accelerating and disappearing from view, indicating advanced maneuverability.
The report mentions the presence of 2 photos related to the incident, although the text does not specify the content of these photos.
An India ink sketch labeled as 'CRUDE HOAX' is included in the report, suggesting the investigation of potential hoaxes or false sightings.
witnesses: Lieutenant Commander Richard Byrd and five others
